page.title: 01THE LOCATION OF AMMANFORD
page.content: Ammanford is set between the Betws and the Black Mountain. The town derived it's name from the river Amman. The people used to cross the river at a ford. The Amman's source is the Black Mountain but it is nearing it's end in Ammanford because it joins the river Loughor just south of the town. The Amman meanders through Ammanford and at Pontamman it's force is causing concern, so the authorities have strengthened the bridge. There is a concrete weir across the river near Betws Park. The river flows on southwestward to join the Loughor at Two Rivers,Pantyffynon. The Loughor is very strong in Pantyffynon and it's meanders have eroded local farmland. Both rivers have been straightened a little and their banks strenghtened, to reduce the risk of flooding.
